summary: The document is a classified FBI memorandum dated August 9, 1963, related to the JFK assassination system. It discusses investigations into anti-Castro activities, focusing on individuals like DAN CHAPPEL and ALBERTO BAYO, who were involved in or connected to activities against Cuba. The memo details contacts with informants familiar with anti-Castro activities in the New York area and mentions the financing of raids on Cuba by an American citizen formerly in a Cuban prison.
key_findings: The document is part of the FBI's records on the JFK assassination system, classified as SECRET.
It mentions DAN CHAPPEL, a cattle breeder and former politician in Miami, who was involved in gambling enterprises in Cuba and lost money given by an unknown syndicate in the U.S.
ALBERTO BAYO, aka Captain Bayo, is identified as EDUARDO PEREZ, a Cuban exile described as talkative, unpredictable, and undependable, previously connected with Alpha 66.
The memo indicates ongoing discreet inquiries into anti-Castro activities and the identity of individuals financing raids on Cuba.
